snippet: Residents of Ozone Park had hoped a $4 billion convention center and casino would bring jobs to their working-class neighborhood, but state talks with the developer broke down last week.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo reports that negotiations with the Genting Group, Malaysian conglomerate that was expected to fund a $4 billion convention center and casino in Ozone Park, Queens, have broken down; demise of project, which would have provided area with money, jobs and much-needed renewal, comes as a disappointment to many.
lead_paragraph: Residents of Ozone Park had hoped a $4 billion convention center and casino would bring jobs to their working-class neighborhood, but state talks with the developer broke down last week.

headline.seo: In Ozone Park, Queens, Frustration at Loss of Planned Convention Center
headline.main: Dashed Hopes in Queens as Convention Plan Falters
headline.print_headline: Dashed Hopes in Queens As Convention Plan Falters
